12 DAYS OF SPECIALS - DAY 9 - BETWEEN GOODS - We are excited about this happy little notecard + coordinating envelope set based on the Between fabric collection! Eight different flat notecard designs in a spectrum of colors and designs are complemented by four colors of bright and spring-y envelopes for mix and match options.⁠
⁠
High quality AG vinyl stickers are weatherproof, waterproof, and durable. They are perfect for adding lasting flair to all your stuff: phones, tablets, and computers, water bottles, instrument cases, luggage, journals and notebooks, sewing machines, bikes and cars, and more! Our newest set, based on artwork from the Between fabric collection, is a fun combination of quirky florals, snail friends, and a rainbow moon! Stickers are 2” - 3” and come in a set of five, one of each design.⁠
Our Autumn Sale will continue throughout the month making almost all items available at a discount.⁠
⁠
Fabric and notions (bundles, yardage, notions, and threads) are 15% off with code FABRIC15.⁠
Goods (most other items, including sewing patterns) are 25% off with code GOODS25.⁠
Use both codes to get 15% or 25% off most items! ⁠
*Excludes on sale items, presale items & gift cards.⁠
⁠
BUY A BOX - Remember to ‘buy a box’ with your first order to take care of shipping for the event, then use the code IBOUGHTABOX each day (including the day you buy a box) at checkout to tell us you have bought a box, to hold your order until the end, and to avoid being charged shipping again. You may order any other items in the shop to add to your box with the combined shipping code! ⁠

12 DAYS OF SPECIALS - DAY 9 - TRES IN THICKET KIT - Tres, the number three in Spanish, is a simple and fast quilt design that produces a beautiful outcome. The name refers to the three different sizes of corner accents used to create variation within the blocks. In the past we have made Tres quilts with the larger part of each block as background, then a variety of corner accent fabrics. We’ve mixed it up this time - multiple background fabrics with one accent fabric - and we love how it turned out! We are happy to offer this new kit in a mix of Thicket and Century Solids for Day 9! Kit includes fabric for the quilt top and binding and a PDF pattern and finishes at 49 1/2” x 60 1/2”. A special thanks to Amy @daniora for making the lovely sample quilt for this kit!

12 DAYS OF SPECIALS - DAY 10 - CATHEDRAL QUILT LASER CUT KIT - Cathedral is a beautiful and simple design reminiscent of cathedral windows. It uses a raw edge appliqué quilting technique to stitch the raw edges and quilt the piece in one simple step. We are happy to offer this version as a laser cut kit for Day 8! The kit includes pre-cut/pre-fused raw edge appliqué pieces to make a quilt top as shown + a PDF pattern. No pre-fusing and cutting of fussy shapes makes putting this top together a breeze! Add (3) yards of fabric for the background and binding and you will have all the materials needed to make this distinctive quilt top. The background fabric shown is Alison Glass Kaleidoscope in Black which can be purchased separately here. We also recommend Kaleidoscope in Pepper or Smoke. Quilt finishes at approximately 54'' x 54''.⁠
⁠

12 DAYS OF SPECIALS - DAY 10 - NEW ENAMEL ORNAMENTS - We are happy to share two brand new ornament designs for 2022! This time around we went with the iconic AG rainbow flower and a more traditional snow globe design. We love them and hope you will too! AG ornaments are jewelry quality. They are struck from brass, plated in high polish silver, then buffed to a smooth glossy finish. Each one is a tiny work of art.⁠

12 DAYS OF SPECIALS - DAY 11 - CANDY DOTS QUILT KIT - The Candy Dots Appliqué Quilt was designed, pieced, and quilted by our friend Erica. We are happy to offer this lovely Sun Print edition kit! With a simple circle design focused on pretty color gradation, it uses a raw edge appliqué technique to stitch the edges and quilt the piece in one step.⁠
The circles are pre-cut (you don’t have to cut them!!!) with fusible web already applied, so this top could hardly be any easier to put together. The background is a mix of low volume AG prints. The kit includes PDF download instructions, fabrics for the quilt top, and binding. Quilt finishes at 48” x 60”.⁠

12 DAYS OF SPECIALS - DAY 12 - NEW ZIPPER PULLS - We are very excited about our new I HEART STITCHING zipper pull sets! Choose from Hazel/Green, Amber/Brown, or Blue/Grey eye color + coordinating heart and thimble. AG enamel bag pulls are jewelry quality. They are struck from brass, plated in high polish silver, then buffed to a smooth glossy finish. Each one is a tiny work of art. Use the included 8 mm split rings to securely attach them to pouches, bags, jackets, or whatever else you need to zip. They are also pretty as charms for necklaces and bracelets – or whatever you can imagine! We hope you will love the new designs as much as we do!⁠

We are delighted to announce the second Trinket Sew Along! In 2019 we gathered together to sew Alison’s Trinket blocks for the first time. It was a resounding success, creating a strong sense of community and resulting in a wide and unique variety of Trinket blocks and projects. Trinket is the perfect pattern for a sew along, and we can't wait to join together once again for more Trinket fun this year!⁠
⁠
Will you join us for the Trinket Sew Along? Link in profile to visit www.alisonglass.com for the details!⁠
⁠
The event will run from the end of March until the end of June, with sewing starting the first week of April. The 2023 Trinket Sew Along brings the second edition of the Trinket quilt pattern, and we are thrilled about this new release. The booklet itself is particularly special, with a velvety full photo cover + an additional informative band. The band includes all of the usual pattern information, allowing the pattern cover to showcase a full-spread photo of the original Trinket quilt, along with a stunning version created by @tulapink and quilted by @angelafmq! The second edition of the Trinket quilt pattern also includes a number of exciting additions and updates! We hope you'll join in!⁠

Bonnie Christine @bonniechristine and I had a chance to get together via Zoom to chat about fabric design, our love of Adobe Illustrator, and her workshop and course. It was so fun to connect, and I'm sharing the link to the recording with you - link in profile - if you care to listen. Note: Use passcode: 4x4g1Y4^ to login to the chat.⁠
⁠
The free workshop, "Secrets to Success in Surface Pattern Design," is open to watch for another week or so. The follow-up to the free workshop is Immersion, an eight-week online training program for those who want to learn Adobe Illustrator, the art of surface pattern design, how to become a licensing artist, and how to create a sustainable business as a creative entrepreneur.⁠
⁠
Today, as an established fabric designer, if I were to rewind a dozen years back to where I was then — wanting to design fabric and not knowing how — I would enroll in this course as a fast track to figuring it out.⁠
⁠
Enrollment for Immersion is open now. As an affiliate for Bonnie, I have the option to offer a coaching bonus for anyone who signs up for Immersion through the link on my website.⁠
⁠
If you'd like more information about any of this please visit the link in profile or www.alisonglass.com.⁠
⁠

Will you join the 2023 Trinket Sew Along?
.
We would love for you to participate in this fun event! Sign up for the sew along through the link our bio and visit the Trinket Sew Along landing page at alisonglass.com for all of the details.
AFTER YOU SIGN UP - 
We would love for you to download the ‘I’M IN!’ graphics and post them on your feed! Posting helps us spread the word about the SAL and could win you a gift certificate. We will randomly select a few participants who post the graphic to win a $25 gift card to www.alisonglass.com between now and April 4, 2023. 💙Don't forget to include the hashtags #TrinketSAL2023, #TrinketSAL, #alisonglass, and #TrinketQuilt when you post! (We want to be able to find you!)
.
#sewwiththebest #incolororder #sewalong #roygbiv

We want the Trinket Sew Along to be fun and challenging - but we also know that people can unexpected things come up in life. To help people finish, we have added EASE into this year's Trinket schedule!⁠
⁠
Specific blocks will be assigned each week AND we've added 5 BONUS SEWING WEEKS throughout the event to provide time to catch up or work ahead, depending on your schedule. Additionally, finished project submissions are not due until August 31, 2023. (We want everyone to feel like they can earn the Finisher Pin!!) - Sign ups are open now, link in bio. All the details can be found at alisonglass.com⁠
 #TrinketSAL2023 #TrinketSAL #alisonglass #TrinketQuilt #agkaleidoscope #sewwiththebest #andoverfabrics⁠

We love Tula’s, @Tulapink, version of Trinket and feel delighted to get to include it on the new pattern cover along with the original version! She went all out and made such a beautiful variety of Trinket blocks - a whole forest of trees and a neighborhood of houses. Swipe through to get a better look at the lovely quilting done by Angela Walters, @angelafmq. They make beautiful quilts together. 
.
We will be sharing the other quilts featured in the Trinket 2nd edition pattern over the next few weeks to inspire you to join us for the #TrinketSAL and make your very own, specific to you, Trinket quilt. Will you make a fleet of boats as your border? Extra gemstones? There are so many ways to have fun with this pattern and sew along with us and also make something uniquely YOU! Sign ups are open now and we officially start 3/28/2023 - all the details are available at alisonglass.com - link in bio.
.

We are gearing up for the 2023 Trinket Sew Along. We are thrilled that so many of you have already decided to join us! It's going to be a wonderful time together, and we cannot wait to see your unique creations. The beauty that we are sharing today is by Sue-ann, @_soulstitches_. The bright Trinkets dance on this low volume background - we love it!⁠
⁠
Again, while we want the sew along to challenge you, we also want it to be enjoyable! We've added extra EASE to the block schedule this year! Specific blocks are due most weeks, but we have included 5 BONUS SEWING WEEKS throughout the event to provide time to catch up or work ahead, depending on what works best for you. There is even time tacked on in the summer for you to ponder your layout options. Remember! You only have to make 40 blocks, one of each, and sew it into a quilt top to be eligible for the cute finisher pin! Starting 3/28! Join today via the link in bio or at alisonglass.com.⁠
.⁠

The #TrinketSAL2023 will run from the end of March until the end of June, with sewing starting the first week of April. (Psssst - tops aren't due until the end of August - so you will have PLENTY of time to finish and earn your pin!) More info on alisonglass.com - link in the bio.⁠

We are so happy to share Alison's latest collection, Wildflowers! It is a follow-up to Between fabric collection, and the fabrics flow freely from one to the next. The two groups work well together, with Wildflowers filling in more of the blue/purple part of the color spectrum.⁠
⁠
Wildflowers fabric feels like walking in a woodland forest, a wildflower meadow, or on the edge of the sea - and really taking it all in. It's about not missing any of the details - fields of flowers filled with butterflies, woodland flora and fauna, the sweetest hidden tiny garter snakes, rolling hills, rocks, ponds, seeds promising more to come, and so many flowers.⁠
⁠
The AG Team will be using Wildflowers in our version of the Trinket quilt for the Trinket Sew Along beginning at the end of March. We would love for you to join us for this fun event! Check the link in bio for free shipping through 3/13!⁠
.⁠
#trinketsal #trinketsal2023 #alisonglass #sewwiththebest #agwildflowers #wildflowers #sewalong

CAROUSEL MEDALLION BOM - It's so pretty!⁠
⁠
LINK IN PROFILE for all the details.⁠
⁠
We are thrilled to announce that sign ups are open for our first BLOCK OF THE MONTH (BOM) program! After all the love for @maeberrysquare Jessica Plunkett’s Pineapple Bullseye quilt this past holiday season, we are excited to share her latest design - a medallion style quilt, named the Carousel Medallion Quilt. Because, you know, both medallion quilts and carousels go round and round! We are truly enamored with Jessica’s lovely, playful design!⁠
⁠
The Carousel BOM program will run from April through November 2023. April is for gathering supplies and joining the (optional) AG Stitch Club online community. Cutting and sewing start in early May. We will have participation patches and finisher pins as well as all of the other typical AG goodness to make this a great first BOM!⁠
⁠
The goal of this BOM (besides ending up with a gorgeous new quilt) is to make a fun, beginner-friendly project, with an emphasis on slowing down and enjoying the process. This is a low key, slower paced program with an emphasis on skill building. You will learn and practice a number of foundational quilting skills including half square triangles, flying geese, and sewing curves. A medallion style quilt builds on itself layer by layer and it will come together more easily and efficiently when care is put toward construction. ⁠
⁠
The Carousel Medallion BOM will begin with a detailed cutting and organization process to get you ready and totally prepared for the fun of sewing. We will practice our skills in a relaxed and supportive atmosphere including tips and video tutorials. The Carousel Medallion quilt finishes at 76” x 76”. #CarouselMedallion #alisonglass #maeberrysquaretutorial

Hi there! We're absolutely THRILLED to extend this official invitation for you to join me, @maeberrysquare, and the AG Team for the Carousel Medallion Block of the Month event! 💖 We ADORE this quilt and can't wait to sew it together in our super supportive and fun environment. 🌟 We'll be sharing amazing tips and tricks to elevate your quilting skills throughout our journey together! Make the quilt as shown or choose different fabrics to create your own distinct version. 🎨 Find all the exciting details on the Carousel Medallion Block of the Month landing page at http://alisonglass.com (link in profile). #CarouselMedallion #alisonglass #maeberrysquare

This one's just for fun - because we can't help ourselves when it comes to building multi-photo images in the grid! Check out the feed for the entire puzzle. @alisonglass and her crew had a fun, albeit chilly, time taking the Carousel Medallion quilt to the Greenway Carousel in Boston for an on-theme photo shoot. The carousel's creatures are inspired by the air, sea, and land animals of Boston and New England. It wasn't running when we visited, but it will open up again once the weather warms up! The AG + @maeberrysquare Carousel Medallion Block of the Month is open for sign ups! All the details can be found on the BOM landing page at alisonglass.com (link in profile). #CarouselMedallion #alisonglass #maeberrysquare

Carousel Medallion Block of the Month is coming up! If you want to master essential skills, connect with others, and create a truly beautiful medallion quilt in the process - this one’s for you! Link in profile for details and to sign up. @maeberrysquare #alisonglass #maeberrysquare #CarouselMedallion

Thank you to JK Quilts for being one of our Week 4, 2023 Trinket Sew Along sponsoring shops. They have generously donated a $50 gift certificate to a lucky participant. ⁠
.⁠
JK Quilts is a family affair. We are owned and operated by a mom and her four daughters in our home state of Idaho. We love bright and happy fabric and the joy that creating brings to the lives of us and our customers. We specialize in complete quilt kits and take pride in having a large selection of projects ready to go both in our shop and on our website. Free shipping on all orders over $149.⁠
.⁠
Make and share your Shapes #1, #2, #3, #4 & #5 blocks to your public account with the hashtags #TrinketSAL2023, #TrinketSAL, #alisonglass, and #TrinketQuilt to be eligible for one of these weekly prizes! Please note that the deadlines for posting will be at Sunday 4/30, midnight of your local time zone. Details for signing up for the 2023 Trinket Sew Along are at the link in bio. We would love for you to join in the fun!⁠

Thank you to Hummingbird Lane Fabrics & Notions for being one of our Week 4, 2023 Trinket Sew Along sponsoring shops. They have generously donated a $50 gift certificate to a lucky participant. ⁠
.⁠
Hummingbird Lane is a boutique fabric shop specializing in high quality modern fabrics that are bright and vibrant. ⁠

Fabric RAINBOWS! This is Sun Print 2023 + coordinating @andoverfabrics Century Solids. We will be sharing a new project with this combination in the next couple of months and it looks so good! #alisonglass #sunprintfabrics #agsunprint #sunprint23

It’s week 5 of the Trinket Sew Along and we are doing a little catch up with posting our blocks! Here's Shapes 3, a little triangle, sewn by the AG Team member @daniora. Link in profile for more information. #TrinketSAL2023 #TrinketSAL #alisonglass #TrinketQuilt⁠

The Carousel Medallion Block of the Month starts this weekend! We are thrilled to get going on this gorgeous quilt and connect with the group who will make it together over the next eight months! We would LOVE for you to join in for this fun event where we will practice skills and enjoy the company of friends - there’s still plenty of time to join in, purchase a kit or gather your supplies locally. The fabric requirements are super reasonable for a quilt this size and all of the cutting takes place in the first month - so it is VERY efficient with both the amount of fabric needed and getting all of the cutting out of the way early - so that we can fully focus on sewing in the coming months!⁠
⁠
We also totally know that people learn differently, and one of the main points of the BOM is learning, so we are excited to present the information in a few different ways: we have written text; we have lots of visual diagrams that one could almost follow without reading (but please read!); and each month, Alison Glass and Jessica Plunkett will host a live Zoom to go over the techniques and any tips. These sessions will be recorded if you can’t make it to the live presentation.⁠
⁠
We’d love you to join in! Click the link in profile to the Carousel Medallion BOM landing page for more information or visit alisonglass.com! #CarouselMedallion #alisonglass #maeberrysquare⁠

It’s week 5 of the Trinket Sew Along! Here's Shapes 4, sewn by the AG Team member @daniora. About the Trinket quilt pattern: A trinket is typically thought of as a small item of little worth. Its value comes from what it means and the memories it holds. The forty blocks in this pattern are little trinkets in four categories: lines, shapes, things, and life. The Trinket quilt is about the process and journey of creating. It is an opportunity to let your mind wander as you connect your own meaning to each block. Memories of the past, present, or dreams for the future: the meaning is yours to create. Trinket Sew Along is happening now! Link in profile for more information and to join in. #TrinketSAL2023 #TrinketSAL #alisonglass #TrinketQuilt⁠

Thank you to YvetteRene Creations for being one of our Week 5, 2023 Trinket Sew Along sponsoring shops. They have generously donated a $50 gift certificate to a lucky participant. ⁠
.⁠
Hey y'all! I'm Yvette, owner of YvetteRene Creations. At the heart of everything I do is Foundation Paper Piecing (FPP). I have created a wonderful community of FPPers in my online membership, Piecing It Real. YvetteRene Creations has all the things you need to support your FPP wants and needs (including ALL the Mini Series patterns). Alison Glass, Tula Pink, Sweetwater, Robin Pickens and eye-catching batiks can all be found in my shop. I carry the entire line of WonderFil's Alison Glass #8 Perle Cotton embroidery thread and I'm working on building up my WonderFil collection. My FPP Project Box is the FIRST of its kind and I'm very proud of it. And finally, I host Yvette's Perfectly Pieced Quilting Retreats to bring my mad FPP skills and exclusive patterns to YOU. Find out more: YvetteRene Creations | https://theyvetterene.com⁠
.⁠

The Buzzz pattern is a circle of pretty bees, shown here in Alison's Wildflowers fabric + Karlee Porter's @karleeporterdesign new Honey Bee edge to edge quilting motif! Really love this combination of Wildflowers fabric for our Shapes 5 AG Team Trinket SAL Block! Amy from the AG Team is making all of our blocks this time in a combination of Alison's Wildflowers fabric + @andoverfabrics coordinating Century Solids. #TrinketSAL2023 #TrinketSAL #alisonglass #TrinketQuilt

NEW HOLIDAY BUNDLE - I know it's May! I'm definitely a 'want the season to match the activity' type of person! That said, we are fans of Giuseppe's @giucy_giuce fabric line Nonna (a sweet fabric line about Giuseppe's grandmother, her home, and all the love within it), and this one - Natale - is a follow-up. I love the not-too-Christmasy feel and the deep colors. To AG things up a bit, we've created a Natale Companion Bundle - 12 Alison Glass fabrics that coordinate and add some extra saturated colors to the group. We really like how it all comes together, as shown in the photo. Fat quarter and half-yard bundles are in the alisonglass.com shop now!

Grapefruit and greenery is what's up for our next group of Trinket Blocks: Shapes 6 - 10! Really love this combination of Wildflowers fabric for our Shapes 6 AG Team Trinket SAL Block! Amy from the AG Team is making all of our blocks this time in a combination of Alison's Wildflowers fabric + @andoverfabrics coordinating Century Solids. #TrinketSAL2023 #TrinketSAL #alisonglass #TrinketQuilt

A year ago, we skipped our Annual Summer Sale and instead hosted a Moving Sale! It's hard to believe it's already been a year - the dust is still settling, but we're making great progress in catching up and even getting a bit ahead! ⁠

SCARABS!!! These colorful beetles first showed up in the Ellipse line as a fun border surprise. Then Alison decided they would make a fun, all over, blender print to include in Sun Print 2023. Have you had enough yet? We haven't - Jessica Plunkett (@maeberrysquare) liked them too and featured them in the middles of many of her Pineapple Bullseye block centers.⁠
⁠
This quilt uses the Ellipse fabric collection by Alison Glass for Andover Fabrics. Ellipse is a blender line in a vivid, fresh, full spectrum Alison Glass color palette. Each design features tiny and small ovals with florals, scarabs, and rainbow abacuses for added interest and fun. Think of the floral stripe, scarabs, and abacuses as a glorified selvedge, a bonus to do something fun with, surrounded by a whole lot of useful dot and stripe fabric in a full range of bold colors.⁠ ⁠
⁠
There are quilt kits and bundles of Ellipse and Sun Print 2023 available - Get your scarabs while you can! Details about our Summer Sale are at alisonglass.com, direct link in the bio!⁠

Hello Friends! AG SUMMER SALE⁠
⁠
It’s time for the annual Alison Glass Summer Sale!⁠
⁠
A year ago, we skipped our Annual Summer Sale and instead hosted a Moving Sale! It's hard to believe it's already been a year - the dust is still settling, but we're making great progress in catching up and even getting a bit ahead! Thank you for all your patience, kind words, and encouragement this year. We'll have more exciting new things to share soon, but for now, let's enjoy a sitewide sale! We only host two big sales a year, so it's a great time to look around the shop for anything you might like to stock up on or have been thinking about. We've added some new bundles, restocked MANY yardage options, and are excited to offer items that we hope will inspire your creativity! Enjoy!⁠

We chatted on zoom a few weeks ago with the Trinket folk - about quilting Trinket quilts. Alison remembered that our friend Erica used the Trinket motifs in a fun way on a wall quilt. We are so happy to share Alison's newest fabric collection, Chrysanthemum! This lovely collection of 24 prints inspired by the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston, MA, is layered with texture and movement, colors and shapes reminiscent of the captivating spaces throughout the museum; in particular, the courtyard, filled with heirloom varieties of chrysanthemums arranged in a Japanese style called okigu where the blossoms are towering on 4-foot tall stems. Truly a unique setting filled with light and artistry. Chrysanthemum ships in November 2023, and we look forward to how you will use it in your projects. We would love for you to check back later this week because we will be sharing more images and quilt ideas!⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠
#alisonglass #agchrysanthemum #chrysanthemumfabric #andoverfabrics⁠

Lumen is a modern minimalist quilt pattern designed by Nydia Kehnle for Alison Glass. We love how it looks in the Chrysanthemum fabric collection, and the dynamic movement created through effective color placement. The layers of color and shapes in this fabric line create a wonderful texture and add an element of depth, almost like a stained glass window design. Learn more at alisonglass.com.⁠

Cathedral is a beautiful and simple design reminiscent of cathedral windows. It uses a raw edge appliqué quilting technique to stitch the raw edges and quilt the piece in one simple step. Shown in the Chrysanthemum fabric line by Alison Glass for Andover Fabrics. Learn more at alisonglass.com.⁠

#alisonglass #agchrysanthemum #chrysanthemumfabric #andoverfabrics #cathedralquilt

On the far end of The Gothic Room at the Gardner Museum, a large cathedral-style window allows sunlight into the otherwise fairly dim room. The window glows. This design, 'Sunlight', pieces together a number of interesting window shapes in the museum, especially illuminated by the darkness of so many of the rooms. The Chrysanthemum fabric collection ships in November 2023. ⁠
⁠
@gardnermuseum #alisonglass #agchrysanthemum #chrysanthemumfabric #andoverfabrics #IsabellaStewartGardnerMuseum⁠
⁠

The Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston is a texture and fabric lover’s dream! Everywhere you look, there is another print, another layer, another detail. 'Lace' is a layered interpretation of a stripe peeking through a bit of crochet lace. The Chrysanthemum fabric collection by Alison Glass for Andover Fabrics ships in November.⁠
⁠
@gardnermuseum #alisonglass #agchrysanthemum #chrysanthemumfabric #andoverfabrics #IsabellaStewartGardnerMuseum⁠
⁠
⁠

Although there is a room named 'The Tapestry Room' at the Isabella, the entire museum is, in reality, filled with fibers of all sorts. It's definitely worth a visit for any fabric enthusiast. 'Tapestry' offers just a glimpse at one of the many designs found in the museum. The Chrysanthemum fabric collection by Alison Glass for Andover Fabrics is inspired by the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston. The collection ships in November 2023.⁠
⁠
@gardnermuseum #alisonglass #agchrysanthemum #chrysanthemumfabric #andoverfabrics #IsabellaStewartGardnerMuseum⁠
⁠

In the Short Gallery of the Gardner Museum, a hinged display houses hundreds of pencil sketches or "old master" drawings, as well as newer works. Paging through the floor-to-ceiling glass-covered display cases, the simple beauty of the drawings stands out as noteworthy and enjoyable. Alison wanted to capture this feeling by piecing together a number of her original first-draft sketches from various fabrics over many years. 'Sketch' is a light, neutral design perfect for backgrounds. Part of the Chrysanthemum fabric collection for Andover Fabrics, it ships in November.⁠
⁠
@gardnermuseum #alisonglass #agchrysanthemum #chrysanthemumfabric #andoverfabrics #IsabellaStewartGardnerMuseum⁠

Amy, AG Studio Manager, had to say about this whole cloth sample quilt: "Hand Stitching is not usually in my wheelhouse, but the Cozy Quilt was surprisingly enjoyable and relaxing to make. I'm still in awe of the results I got! Now I want to make another one, it's so pretty!"⁠

The great thing about 100% cotton jersey knit is that it’s super forgiving. Hand cutting might sound tedious, but for this project, it’s actually quite easy and soothing. The edges don’t fray; instead, they curl just slightly, creating a comfortable, perfectly worn in look.⁠
⁠
"I am obsessed with this technique! Making the sample quilt was pure joy as every time I cut out a shape it was a surprise-the colors seemed to glow beneath the knit once they were revealed. As a sensory experience, the knit is so soft and the hand stitching is very grounding. I have made 3 more Cozy quilts and already have my fabric pulled for the SAL!”⁠
⁠
- Amanda, maker of the Rainbow Squares + Scattered Petals sample⁠
⁠
Cozy Quilt Workshop and SAL signups open now until 11/7. Visit alisonglass.com for more information. #alisonglass #cozysewalong

The Cozy Workshop will be a combination of video and written instruction. Project instructions will be fully supported via video. The written portion will be a series of PDF downloads in our AG Stitch Club Journal format - a magazine style journal filled with special features to learn more - as well as inspirational images, full written instructions, four print at home stencil options, and many photos and tips to complete your project. The AG Team is thrilled to offer the Cozy Workshop & Sew Along in this format - more interactive, easier to navigate, all the parts in one place - it’s going to be great!⁠
⁠
Sign-ups open now until 11/7. Visit alisonglass.com for more information. #alisonglass.com #cozysewalong

It's true, out of all the quilts that find their way to Alison's house, the Cozy Quilts are the family's favorites to actually use. It’s like wrapping up in your favorite cotton sweatshirt! The jersey knit is exceptionally soft, and with a couple of layers plus the middle quilting cotton layer, it achieves the perfect balance of warmth and weight. ⁠
⁠
Cozy Workshop and SAL sign-ups close tonight, 11/7! Visit alisonglass.com for more information. #alisonglass #cozysewalong

All 12 days items SHIP FREE in the US! Check back each day to see what fun surprises we have for you and add to your order throughout the event!⁠
⁠
For Day 2, we are happy to offer five styles of scissors and snips from one of our favorite companies, LDH Scissors! ⁠
⁠
In 1990, LDH Scissors was founded in Shenzhen, just outside of Hong Kong, by a young couple who simply needed better quality sewing scissors. Built with Love, Dedication and Happiness, the company has been serving the sewing community ever since. Fast forward to 2018, their son Roy and his wife Ursula have brought the company to Toronto, Canada, bringing with them the same Love, Dedication and Happiness (LDH) that made it all possible.⁠

12 DAYS OF SPECIALS - DAY 4 - Fancy Stitches Workshop⁠
⁠
All 12 days items SHIP FREE in the US! Check back each day to see what fun surprises we have for you and add to your order throughout the event!⁠
⁠
In 2020, we ran a really fun six-month-long program called Alison Glass Stitch Club. Each month, we explored a different hand stitching technique, and it remains one of our most talked-about events so far. We are thrilled to offer the workshops again as individual downloads, now available at a really super introductory discount! Enjoy!⁠
⁠
In the Fancy Stitches Workshop, we explore five types of stitches along with various variations. All these stitches fall within the realm of couching, woven, or filled stitches. They are not difficult but produce impressive results! The projects start as samplers for each stitch type, and then you can turn these samplers into small projects if you wish. We include three projects in the workshop, but you have the freedom to choose whatever you’d like.⁠
⁠
The Fancy Stitches Workshop is presented in a magazine-style journal that, along with the tutorials and projects, includes a lot of additional detail. This includes background information on techniques, articles about artists related to the theme, and inspirational images.⁠
⁠
Our projects incorporate a range of beautiful yarns, which significantly enhance the texture and interest of the pieces. We understand that some of you already have a large yarn stash, while others do not. Therefore, we have curated a starter kit to make collecting a wide variety of textures and colors easy and affordable. Every bit of yarn in the kit is of high quality and lovely! You can also do any of these stitches with only Perle, which creates a really sweet and elegant look!⁠
⁠
We hope you will love our 12 Days of Holiday Specials and that it will be a fun addition to the season for you!⁠

Today’s New Kit: Prism in Wildflowers Kit

Prism is a spectrum of color in a throw size quilt that looks more complicated than it is. We’ve put together a fun new kit featuring the Wildflowers fabric collection. Utilizing a clever technique of piecing, slicing, and rearranging, the pattern produces beautiful results fast. We love our sample (by Amanda) shown with Andover Century Solids Orchid as the background, but many other colors would look amazing as well!

The kit includes fabric for the pieced sections in both the front and back of the quilt + scrappy binding. Choose your own background and backing to add separately, or to use fabrics from your stash. Quilt finishes at 57″ x 64″.

Today’s Stitch Club Journal: The Embroidery Workshop and Starter Kit

In 2020, we ran a really fun six-month-long program called Alison Glass Stitch Club. Each month, we explored a different hand stitching technique, and it remains one of our most talked-about events so far. We are thrilled to offer the workshops again as individual downloads, now available at a really super introductory discount! Enjoy!

The Embroidery Workshop focuses on outline stitches, filled stitches, and french knots. Specifically we will look at the backstitch, stem stitch, chain stitch, seed stitch, satin stitch, long and short stitch, and french knots. These stitches form the basics of what we tend to picture when we think of hand embroidery. Vintage tea towels and linens you might have from years ago were commonly stitched with basic outline and filled stitches. These concepts form an understanding for many more complex stitches and techniques.

Today’s Stitch Club Journal: Broderie Perse Workshop + Starter Kit

In 2020, we ran a really fun six-month-long program called Alison Glass Stitch Club. Each month, we explored a different hand stitching technique, and it remains one of our most talked-about events so far. We are thrilled to offer the workshops again as individual downloads, now available at a really super introductory discount! Enjoy!

The  Broderie Perse Workshop focuses on adding decorative stitches to printed fabric. Projects can be as simple as choosing a favorite fabric to embellish, or a more complicated project inspired by broderie perse or crazy quilting. We hope the inspiration here will spark a fun, new project for you!

In the workshop we take a close look at the work of Nichole Vogelsinger of Wild Boho. Nichole and Alison created a joint Color Wheel project for the workshop. Alison cut, arranged, and fused the pieces, and Nichole completed the more difficult task of stitching! We love how it turned out!

The workshop also touches on embellishing whole cloth pieces of fabric and making embroidered patches.

We have put together a Color Wheel Kit to help with supply gathering, or use favorites from your stash!

The  Broderie Perse Fabric Workshop is presented in a PDF magazine-style journal that, along with the tutorials and projects, includes background information on techniques, articles about artists related to the theme, and inspirational images.

It's the 12th (and last) day of the annual 12 Days of Holiday Specials and today we have Mystery Boxes! ⁠
⁠
Each Mystery Surprise Box is filled with fabric, patterns, and finished goods! It is over $200 of product and the fun is in the surprise of not knowing quite what you will receive!⁠
⁠
Visit alisonglass.com to see all of the fabric options and details - there's a lot to choose from this time!⁠
⁠
What is in the box (or bag if sent with other items)?⁠
⁠
When we cut fabric at the studio we end up with sizable chunks of each line left over at the end - not large enough for a full bundle cut, but plenty of usable fabric to do something with! These fabric cuts are the basis for our Mystery Surprise Boxes! ⁠
⁠
Each fabric chunk of cuts is over a pound (some approaching a pound and a half) and includes a good selection of fabrics in the line. Sizes and numbers of fabrics vary, but each group is a great start to a patchwork project. Choose the fabric line you would like from the drop-down menu for the end cut option.⁠
⁠
OR, choose (12) 1/4 yard cuts in a rainbow of colors for the fabric portion of your box rather than a fabric chunk, and we will put together a pretty set of fabrics for you!⁠
⁠
Either way, choose your fabric, and then we will fill in around it with lots of fun items!⁠
⁠
Each box will include at least:⁠
fabric end cuts of over a pound of your chosen line or (12) 1/4 yard cuts in a rainbow of colors⁠
three 8 x 10 art prints*⁠
three sewing patterns⁠
sticker set⁠
round sticker⁠
embroidery pattern⁠
gift tag set⁠
enclosure card set⁠
a few greeting cards⁠
enamel pin⁠
⁠

The Cozy Sew Along will be starting in January! Have you chosen your jersey knit color yet? We created a jersey knit fabric especially for this project! Alison chose colors in just the right balance of colorful and neutral - designed to blend with many quilting cotton fabrics. The knit is offered in kits of the amount needed to make a 54” x 70” quilt, a bit over 4 yards. The knit we have produced is excellent quality, 100% cotton, medium weight, 60” width. We definitely suggest 100% cotton for this project, rather than a cotton/spandex blend.

Because we have made the knit specifically for this event there is a limit of the number of kits we can make in each color. We don’t expect to run out of any particular color soon, but we also suggest not waiting too long to make fabric choices and place kit orders because of this limit. We want you to get your first choice/choices! The jersey knit kit portion as well as most of the other materials and supplies for this project will ship in December, by the end of the year, for a January start.

Sign-ups for the Cozy Workshop and SAL will open again on 12/21 for a second round of participants. If you know of someone who might like to join please share the news with them. We also want to give a little notice that if you have not ordered your jersey knit kit for the event, it’s a good time to do so for the largest selection of knit colors. #cozysewalong #alisonglass
